summary: A mod that aims to improve diversity, appearance and fixes to NPCs in all manner of looks
descriptionHtml:
[b][color=#ffff00][size=3]>>> PLEASE read the description/FAQs first before commenting on any issues whatsosever <<<<[/size][/color][/b]
[color=#000000]_____ __ ____________________________________________________________________________________[/color]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/gErn7Qq.png[/img][i][color=#f4f4f4] 
[/color][/i]
[color=#ffff00][size=4][b]What is UNO?
[/b][/size][/color][color=#ffff00][font=Verdana]---------------------------------------[/font]
[font=Comic Sans MS]Tired of so many of the NPCs in the vanilla game sharing the same hairstyles and looking too generic and alike? Great. I hated it too. So in the end I made this...[/font][/color]
[font=Comic Sans MS] UNO aims for a more realistic, lore-friendly overhaul, with far greater variety among all NPC appearances. Even with such, i try to make as much sense for each NPC changed.  This mod is inspired and based from Rops1981's original IoS mod, full thanks and credits to him.
Check out the great [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/23755/?]Inhabitants of Skyrim[/url] here. 
[/font]
[font=Comic Sans MS]This mod isn't going to make the elderly folks look like youthful 20-year olds, or make someone look younger than they should be or older than they should be (ok, maybe for a few exceptions), neither randomly throw silly whacky hairstyles on random NPCs. You won't see some strong Nord like Aela looking like a wimpy girl with red lipstick on or an old  like Grelod looking like a 20-year old babe. Rich nobles like Betrid and Vittoria will be more well-dressed with stylish hairstyles while the poorer folks and farmers will keep to a more natural appearance. You get the idea.
[/font]
[font=Comic Sans MS]What this mod aims to do is simple: make all NPCs look good but realistic, look different and most importantly, unlike other NPC mods out there, I intend to be[/font][color=#ffff00][b] true to the vanilla appearance. [/b][/color]

[font=Comic Sans MS]My belief is this:[/font]
[font=Comic Sans MS]NPC appearances should still stay true to vanilla appearances (same hair color, same body shape etc.)[/font]
[font=Comic Sans MS]NPC appearances should match their voicetypes (commander voicetype -->a rugged appearance, youngeager voicetype ---> a more humble appearance or something etc.)[/font]
[font=Comic Sans MS]NPC appearances should match their personalities (brave --> strong appearance, lustful - attractive appearance)[/font]
[font=Comic Sans MS]As such, corrections to vanilla appearances have also been made whenever I found unfitting. [/font]
[size=3]
[font=Trebuchet MS][color=#ffff00][b]What makes this any different from other NPC overhauls?[/b][/color][/font][/size]

[font=Comic Sans MS]UNO doesn't just modifies NPCs, it don't just randomly add random haristyles to random NPCs. Whereas other mods overhaul all NPCs on one big scale of randomness and limited hair assets, UNO overhauls each and every NPC consistently. NPCs are overhauled with carefully made appearances tailored and designed to suit each and every one. [/font]
[font=Comic Sans MS]To make and develop, having taken years to customize almost each and every NPC in the game [/font][color=#ffff00][b]individually[/b][/color][font=Comic Sans MS]. Even it means more hairpacks have to be used to get the right appearances for the NPC. [/font]

[color=#ffff00][b]Exclusivity and diversity[/b][/color][font=Comic Sans MS] is the core focus of this mod, with realism second and everything else under that. [/font]

[font=Comic Sans MS]With so much more assets this mod depends and uses on, there are now far more variety on the different options to take on all NPCs.[/font]
[font=Comic Sans MS]Now your player character is no longer so out-of-place special and different. Because everyone's different. Nearly all 300+ NPCs from the game have been changed very specifically and improved for better diversity and distinguished among one another. For a greater sense of identity, recognition and individuality.[/font]
             [img]http://i.imgur.com/3HnRXTz.jpg[/img]  [size=4] 
      [/size][font=Courier New][size=1]  [/size][/font][font=Times New Roman][color=#d8d8d8][size=1]*Before=>Pure vanilla. No custom textures. No modifications   [/size][/color][/font]
[size=4][font=Times New Roman][color=#ffff00][size=5][b]       
      [img]http://i.imgur.com/DRsVGIT.png[/img][/b][/size][/color][/font][/size]
[size=2]- No more boring repetitive NPC looks. Everyone is completely different now.
- NPCs re-overhauled completely and individually from scratch
- All NPCs have their own exclusive hairs, eyes and style, selectively and carefully chosen for best suitability
- Better facial proportions
- Better facial features for appropriate NPCs (warpaint, scars etc.)
- More varied, individual NPC heights and weights
- Appearances correspond to the NPCs character, environment and personality (miners will still be dirty, warriors will still looked rugged etc.)
- All non-quest NPCs are now protected (patched from NPC Protected Redux)
- NPCs are corrected and modified as truthfully as possible, based on these three main factors:[/size][color=#ffff00]
= Voice-types [/color][color=#ffff00] = Personality[/color][color=#ffff00] = Background[/color][font=Comic Sans MS][size=4]
[/size][/font]
[font=Comic Sans MS]NOTE: Bandits, Children and the Argonian races are NOT touched in this mod, so mods modifying such NPCs are fully compatible. Look at Compatiblity section for more info.[/font]


[size=3][b]REQUIREMENTS[/b]
----------------------------[/size]
[color=#6fa8dc][size=3][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/71214/?]USLEEP[/url][/size]
[size=3][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/10168/?]ApachiiSkyHair[/url]s (Main, Female and Male vers)[/size]
[size=3][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/7403/?]Lovely Hairstyles[/url][/size][size=3]                    [/size][size=3]
SG Hair 268 [/size]
[size=3][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/68311]K[/url][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/68311]S Hairdos -Renewal [/url][/size]
[/color][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/13722/?][size=3]Eyes of Beauty[/size][/url]

[b][size=3]HIGHLY RECOMMENDED MODS
[/size][/b][b][size=3]--------------------------------------[/size][/b][size=2]
[font=Verdana][color=#efefef]If you want the NPCs to look EXACTLY as shown in the screenshots you will need to download and install the following mods. These mods are [u]NOT[/u] required at all however; you can use any other body and skin mods as you wish but appearances will vary accordingly.[/color][/font][/size]
[b][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/2488/?tab=2&navtag=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.nexusmods.com%2Fskyrim%2Fajax%2Fmodfiles%2F%3Fid%3D2488&pUp=1][size=3]Better Males[/size][/url][color=#d8d8d8] - YoungerFacesMergedWithMenByGeonox [/color]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/3563][size=3]Coverwomen[/size][/url][color=#d8d8d8] - Look 4 (remove the tintmasks folder)

OTHER MINOR STUFF:
[size=2][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/35092/?]ApachiiSkyHair naxtural Retexture[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/35303/?]Female Facial Animation[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/33117/?]Realistic Teeth
[/url][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/24828/?]UNBLEAK ENB[/url]/[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/50501/?]Grim and Somber ENB[/url]
[/size][/color][/b][color=#ffff00][size=2][b]

************IMPORTANT***********************[/b][/size][/color]
[size=1]1. UNO alone contains NO assets belonging to any of the above aforementioned mods. Thus,         
ALL mods listed are required.[/size]
[size=1]Failure to follow this correctly will result in a CTD at main menu when you try launching the game!![/size]
[size=1]2. It is advised to start the mod on a new game to avoid possible neck seams.[/size]
[color=#ffff00][size=3]
WHY SO MANY REQUIRED MODS?![/size][/color]
[font=Comic Sans MS]Well, first of all, it'd be impossible for me to get permission to include all the cosmetics mods done by others into UNO, neither possible to port over each and every NPC as a standalone.
Diversity and exclusivity is the key focus here so the number of hairpacks does not matter. 
Because when you have 300+ NPCs being overhauled, it's well more than worth it. [/font]
[font=Comic Sans MS][u][b][color=#ffff00][size=3]
COMPATIBILITY[/size]
----------------------------[/color][/b][/u]
[color=#efefef]Any mod that edits the stats and values of the same vanilla NPCs will conflict with UNO. You can overcome this by putting my mod's ESP below any other relevant conflicting mods but this will revert whatever previous changes are made by the overwritten mods.[/color]
[u]------------------------------------------------------------------
[/u]
[color=#efefef]As for other mods that edit the appearances of vanilla NPCs, you [/color]CAN[color=#efefef] get any of such mods to work together. To put it simply, 
1. First uninstall any NPC altering mods you already have installed
2. Install U.N.O. 
3. Now install back your other NPC mods and choose OK to all overwrites. 
4. Put the mod's ESP BELOW UNO - NPC Overhaul.esp

Or just use the BSA format version. Loose files will take priority and make sure the mod you want as overwrite has its ESP below in load order.

This should effectively replace the related UNO files and give first priority to your other NPC mod. Thus, you get the custom NPC appearances from both.
[/color][color=#efefef]Failure to follow this step correctly, such as sorting the ESPs in a wrong load order or the wrong files getting overwritten, will result in issues like the grey-face "bug". [/color]


[color=#ffff00]Mods that are OK and compatible:[/color]
[color=#efefef]- Any face/skin texture mods[/color]
[color=#efefef]- Any body mods
- Any mods that add new NPCs[/color]
[color=#efefef]- Follower system overhaul mods (AFT, EFF, UFO etc.)[/color]
[color=#efefef]- Children mods (RS Children, TK Children etc.)[/color]
[color=#efefef]- Enemy overhaul mods (Deadly Combat, Revenge of the Enemies etc.)[/color]
[color=#efefef]- Everything else that doesn't edit vanilla NPCs extensively [/color]

[color=#efefef]NOTE: This is a very large overhaul, which will have a rather wide influence on your game. You may encounter a minor neck-seam issue with some NPCs if you choose to uninstall Ultimate NPC Overhaul on the [/color][b]same[/b][color=#efefef] savegame.  This is caused due to the NPCs' weight being stored in your savegame files and not updated when you remove the mod which makes changes to the NPCs weight. [/color]
As such, it is highly advised that you[b] [color=#ff0000]MAKE A BACKUP SAVE BEFORE INSTALLING THIS MOD. [/color][/b]
[color=#ffff00]

[/color][color=#ffff00]FAQs[/color]
[color=#ffff00]----------------------------------------------[/color]
[color=#ffff00]I don't like this/that NPC in the screenshot!![/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]Keep in mind NPCs in screenshots are taken using the recommended mods as mentioned above. Your NPC appearances will NOT look like that if you are using a different skin texture for female or male. If you're not using any male textures, your male NPCs will still look rugged or whatever. [/color]
[b]So don't judge by screenshots alone and if you're not going to try the mod at all, then just ignore it.[/b]

[color=#ffff00]100 to 200? Why keep jumping between big version numbers?[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]Because... I like big numbers.

[/color][color=#ffff00]Will there be a non-USLEEP version? [/color]
[/font][color=#d8d8d8]Removing master dependencies is a tricky thing. When a mod has this many dependencies, removing one will easily corrupt the references. Maybe one day this can be sorted out or maybe never. Unfortunately, I don't have the time any longer to be in the modding scene. Anyone capable of making a non-USKP vers can feel free to do so.

[/color][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#ffff00]Why are all NPCs protected?[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]Only non-quest NPCs are protected to avoid disrupting any quests. The mod was atop Blattgeist's NPC Protected Redux so it's too late to change things as it is now, but any patch for an unprotected version is welcomed. Why would you want to kill these precious innocent NPCs for anyway? You psycho.[/color]

[color=#ffff00]I'm getting the grey face bug on NPCs?[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]That's more than likely a mod conflict than anything else I can think of. Or if not, the other cause would be some corruption in the file contents or ESP if you tried editing it in CK.

If you're still having the problem, try this fix:
- Uninstall any other conflicting NPC mods you're using. 
- [i]Manually[/i] delete ALL files in your Data/meshes/facegendata/skyrim.esm folder and Data/textures/facegendata/facetint/skyrim.esm folder. Or just delete both skyrim.esm folders. Make sure both of the folders are GONE. 
- Then do a complete reinstall of this mod and overwrite the ESP if asked.
- After that, put the mod's .ESP at the very bottom[/color] [color=#d8d8d8]of your load order

[/color][color=#ffff00]I'm getting CTDs on start-up, after Bethesda Logo?[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]You're missing a Master file, a.k.a one of the required mods.[/color]

[color=#ffff00]I'm stuck at the "Imperial Logo" start-up but without main menu?[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]You're using a wrong or outdated version of a Master File, a.k.a one of the required mods. You can check in TE5EDIT if for what errors are involved.[/color]

[color=#ffff00]Do I really need to start a new game for U.N.O. to work?[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]You can still install it on an existing savegame at your own discretion.  The way the game works is like this: only data from NPCs that you have encountered will be stored in that savegame. So if you're still early in-game, it should be mostly fine. 
Some NPCs had their weights changed from the vanilla game so this is just as a precaution unless you don't mind NPCs with black lines around their necks.[/color]
[color=#ffff00]
I like some of the NPCs overhauled but I dislike some others.[/color]
[/font][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#d8d8d8]It's impossible to please everybody unfortunately, so it all comes down to acceptance and choice. If there's one or two NPCs you prefer to keep vanilla, you have to use TES5EDIT to delete the NPC entry from the mod. Then delete the NPC's meshes and textures facegen files (look for the baseID).
[/color][/font][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#ffff00]
I don't like any of the new NPCs. I don't like this at all! What should I do?[/color]
[color=#d8d8d8]Don't download the mod then.
[/color]

[/font][color=#ffff00][size=1]
CREDITS: (apologies if any name mentions are missed out)

[/size][/color]
author: reindeer51
